page.title: 05Village Housing.
page.content: Although the villages of Hundleby and Raithby are close together, they have very different styles of housing. Hundleby has terraces of town houses, some of three storeys. In addition there are a number of small terraced cottages, formerly associated with the local industries of brewery and brick_ works. Raithby, as befits an 'estate village' has a fine Hall with well laid out grounds of some 30 acres, several attractive detached houses, and pairs of cottages, all in matching style. Both villages have some local authority housing and there has been general infilling with modern property _ mainly bungalows.Many of the older properties are built of the local Hundleby bricks with slate or tile roofs.
